overview_of_class:
Corporate Finance 360 will give the student a good overview of the world of Capital Markets including the role of the corporation in society,the concept and definition of risk and reward, size and valuation of the fixed income and equity markets, the definition of derivatives and some trading strategies, balance sheet analysis, project finance, corporate valuation, the investment banking process and corporate bankruptcies and trading of distressed debt.

Course Overview guidelines:

? Definition and significance of capital markets
? Definition of risk and reward and quantification of risk
? Overview of the fixed income market and specific valuation methods
? Various ways to classify equities as well as valuation techniques
? Corporate Valuation and Project Finance methodologies
? The role of an investment banker and banking process as well and bankruptcies.
name: Corporate Finance
subject: FINANCE
